page.title: 11Ecology
page.content: On the outskirts of Harden can be found St.Ives Estate which combines moorland, woodland, parkland and recreation facilities. There is a Nature Trail through the Estate which enables you to see the varied plant life. There are snowdrops, bluebells and many rhododendron bushes depending on the season. You can find both coniferous and deciduous trees in which birds such as curlaws, woodpeckers and cuckoos nest. If you are quiet you may see foxes, squirrels or rabbits. The coppice pond provides a variety of fish for the fisherman. The ducks which nest and breed on the central island enjoy being fed by visitors.
